summary: Musk joined Tesla in 2004, a year after it was founded by engineersMartin EberhardhardandMarc Tarpenning . Musk joined the company in 2004 . He first clarified that he wasn't the founder either .  Musk: "We didn't actually come up with the name Tesla Motors. We didn't own the name. It was a guy in Sacramento who came up with it and owned the name, and we had to buy it off him for $75,000" The Sacramento man wasn't exactly eager to part with his name, so Musk pulled a move straight out of a sitcom .  Elon Musk led Tesla's first major funding round, throwing in $6.5 million of his own money . In April, Tesla sold just 58,459 vehicles in China, down nearly 6% from a year ago . In the first four months of 2025, Tesla’s China sales have declined over 18% year over year to 231,213 units . Ongoing global tariff uncertainty and weakness in China remain concerns .  Tesla may call itself a tech company, but without strong vehicle demand, the story falls apart . Wholesale vehicle shipments from Tesla's Chinese factory dropped 6% over the previous April . The nearly 58,500 cars sold at home and abroad is the lowest number overall since 2022, when the factory struggled to operate at full pace amid citywide lockdowns .  Tesla’s Shanghai operations slid to fourth in the domestic rankings of largest manufacturers of EVs and plug-in hybrids . Geely and SAIC-GM-Wuling as well as market leaderBYD are now the only ones worth more than the next 10 largest automakers combined .  Domestic Tesla sales in China are trending 15% lower so far this quarter . This comes on top of recent data that shows demand for his cars across Europe crashed by 37% in the first quarter . That suggests the deeper problem is that Musk failed to invest in new cars .  Tesla is believed to be preparing a lower-cost auto version of the Y to shore up flagging demand in China . Other unconfirmed speculation centers around the possibility Tesla may be preparing Mini and Maxi versions of the car .  Bears argue EV sales figures like those out of China or Europe proves he’s woefully neglected his core car business . Bulls believe the company is worth more than its current $900 billion market value .

Prashanth Menon leaves Tesla's China team in charge of the India operations . The company recently signed a lease for its first showroom in Mumbai . India is the world's third-largest car market and a key growth target for Tesla .

Tesla denied trademark on the term Robotaxi by the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office . Decision comes in the form of a nonfinal action on Tuesday . Tesla has until August to contest or revise its filing .  Investors should watch for how Tesla responds to the USPTO ruling, as well as the June rollout of its autonomous ride-hailing service in Texas .

Tesla's China-made electric vehicle (EV) sales saw a 6% year-on-year decline in April . The US automotive giant is facing stiff competition from Chinese rivals and a diminishing reputation in Europe . Tesla is seeking to expand into new territories such as India and Saudi Arabia .  Tesla has seen a20% drop in automotive revenuesfor Q1 2025, with earnings falling to $13.97bn from $17.38bn in the previous year . Jeff Bezos-backed Slate is a new car company planning to build electric trucks in the Midwest for 2026 delivery . Competing electric trucks from Tesla and Rivian cost 3 to 4 times more than Slate's compact EV truck . Slate is an electric car company still firmly in start-up mode .  Slate describes its new electric truck as "the most radically simple, wildly personalizable vehicle out there" Pre-orders of Slate trucks, secured by a refundable $50 deposit, began last week . It's likely they've already begun to affect sales of Tesla Cybertrucks and Rivian R1T trucks .  Slate's $69,990 entry price is compared to $71,700 a base Rivian R1T or the $77,700 MSRP on a Rivian . Cybertruck is described as the best-selling vehicle in America, "priced above $100,000"  Blank Slate is a 150-mile range electric truck in two-door pickup configuration . I skipped right past options to add decals or "wrap" the Slate in a different color . I similarly skipped upgrades for all-terrain tires and bigger tires, and left the wheels alone .  Slate offers the option to "bring your own" configuration in which neither stereo nor speakers are installed . Instead, you can add a speaker mount, phone holder, and Bluetooth controls on the steering wheel . Slate doesn't show the price effect of any of its personalization options .  The vast majority of the personalization options seem entirely skippable, without affecting the functionality of the truck . This suggests that buying a bare-bones Slate for close to the advertised price -- again, that's under $20,000 after government tax incentives .  The Motley Fool’s total average return is893% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to162% for the S&P 500 . Rivian Automotive wasn’t one of the 10 stocks that made the cut .  Tesla and Rivian should be nervous about the market for their electric cars . The company has a range of electric cars that start at $20,000 and go on sale for $100,000 .

Quarterly earnings results are a good time to check in on a company’s progress, especially compared to its peers in the same sector . Today we are looking at Ford (NYSE:F) and the best and worst performers in the automobile manufacturing industry . Much capital investment and technical know-how are needed to manufacture functional, safe, and aesthetically pleasing automobiles .  Ford (NYSE:F) reported revenues of $40.66 billion, down 5% year on year . Rivian (NASDAQ:RIVN) reported revenue of $1.24 billion . The manufacturer of Amazon’s delivery trucks, Rivian designs, manufactures, and sells electric vehicles and commercial delivery vans .  Rivian delivered the biggest analyst estimates beat among its peers . Tesla reported revenues of $19.34 billion, down 9.2% year on year, falling short of analysts’ expectations by 8.1% . Tesla delivered the weakest performance against analyst estimates in the group .  General Motors reported revenues of $44.02 billion, up 2.3% year on year . Winnebago (NYSE:WGO) is a manufacturer of recreational vehicles, providing a range of motorhomes, travel trailers, and fifth-wheel products for outdoor and adventure lifestyles .  Winnebago had the slowest revenue growth among its peers . $620.2 million, down 11.9% year on year . The stock is down 7% since reporting and currently trades at $32.33 .  These companies are poised for growth regardless of the political or macroeconomic climate . Still, questions remain about the direction of economic policy . O’Leary said public figures should reflect ideals of growth and success, not opposition to wealth-building . He stressed that this responsibility shapes how the world sees the U.S. "Our number one export is not technology or energy, it's the American dream"  O’Leary: Entrepreneurs like Musk and Zuckerberg are prime examples of the American dream realized .
